abstract: The auto financing arm of Toyota could be an early beneficiary. Reports say it is seeking a $2 billion loan.
snippet: The auto financing arm of Toyota could be an early beneficiary. Reports say it is seeking a $2 billion loan.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO  Japan will dip into its $1 trillion worth of foreign currency reserves to lend dollars to the country’s struggling exporters, the government said Tuesday, a move that could help the carmaker Toyota provide more loans to buyers in the United States.

headline.main: Japan Considers Loans to Struggling Exporters

abstract: Sales were down 53 percent at G.M., 48 percent at Ford and 40 percent at Toyota from February 2008.
snippet: Sales were down 53 percent at G.M., 48 percent at Ford and 40 percent at Toyota from February 2008.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Despite their offers of deeper discounts, automakers had more trouble luring shoppers into showrooms in February, when vehicle sales fell to their lowest level in 28 years.

headline.main: Already Bleak, Auto Sales Take a Fall in February

byline.original: By Bill Vlasic and Nick Bunkley
